Indirect_Addressing_Register_0.description: Indirect addressing register 0, not physically implemented. Any read/write operation accesses RAM pointed by MP0.

MP0.description: 8-bit memory pointer register 0, used to access RAM indirectly via the Indirect addressing register 0.

Indirect_Addressing_Register_1.description: Indirect addressing register 1, not physically implemented. Any read/write operation accesses RAM pointed by MP1.

MP1.description: 8-bit memory pointer register 1, used to access RAM indirectly via the Indirect addressing register 1.

BP.description: Bank pointer register, used to select between data memory banks (Bank 0 or Bank 1).

ACC.description: Accumulator register, closely related to ALU operations and capable of operating with immediate data.

PCL.description: Lower-order byte of the Program Counter, readable and writeable. Moving data into PCL performs a short jump.

TBLP.description: Read/write register indicating the table location for table read instructions (TABRDC, TABRDL).

TBLH.description: Read-only register that stores the higher-order byte of the table word from table read instructions.

STATUS.description: 8-bit register containing status flags: Carry (C), Auxiliary Carry (AC), Zero (Z), Overflow (OV), Power Down (PDF), and Watchdog Time-out (TO).

INTC0.description: Interrupt Control Register 0, controls master, external, Timer/Event Counter 0, and Timer/Event Counter 1 interrupts, and holds their request flags.

TMR0H.description: High byte of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 0.

TMR0L.description: Low byte of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 0.

TMR0C.description: Control register for Timer/Event Counter 0, configuring its operation.

TMR1H.description: High byte of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 1.

TMR1L.description: Low byte of the 16-bit Timer/Event Counter 1.

TMR1C.description: Control register for Timer/Event Counter 1, configuring its operation.

PA.description: Bidirectional 8-bit input/output data register for Port A.

PAC.description: Control register for Port A, determining direction (CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input) and pull-high options.

PB.description: Bidirectional 8-bit input/output data register for Port B.

PBC.description: Control register for Port B, determining direction (CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input), pull-high, or A/D input selection.

PC.description: Bidirectional 8-bit input/output data register for Port C.

PCC.description: Control register for Port C, determining direction (CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input) and pull-high options.

PD.description: Bidirectional 8-bit input/output data register for Port D.

PDC.description: Control register for Port D, determining direction (CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input), pull-high, and PWM output options.

PWM0.description: Data register for Pulse Width Modulation channel 0.

PWM1.description: Data register for Pulse Width Modulation channel 1.

PWM2.description: Data register for Pulse Width Modulation channel 2.

PWM3.description: Data register for Pulse Width Modulation channel 3.

INTC1.description: Interrupt Control Register 1, controls A/D converter and I2C Bus interrupts, and holds their request flags.

HADR.description: I2C Bus slave address register for setting the device's slave address.

HCR.description: I2C Bus control register for configuring I2C operation.

HSR.description: I2C Bus status register for monitoring I2C operation.

HDR.description: I2C Bus data register for transmitting and receiving data.

ADRL.description: Lower-order byte of the 10-bit A/D conversion result.

ADRH.description: Higher-order byte of the 10-bit A/D conversion result.

ADCR.description: Control register for the A/D converter, configuring conversion start and channel selection.

ACSR.description: A/D clock setting register for configuring the A/D conversion clock.

PF.description: Bidirectional 8-bit input/output data register for Port F (48-pin package only).

PFC.description: Control register for Port F, determining direction (CMOS output or Schmitt trigger input) and pull-high options (48-pin package only).
